rule.name: Encounter mode
rule.comment: This is where most of the intense action takes place, and it’s most often used for combat or other high-stakes situations.

rule.name: Exploration mode
rule.comment: In exploration mode, time is more flexible and the play more free form. In this mode, minutes, hours, or even days in the game world pass quickly in the real world, as the characters travel cross country, explore uninhabited sections of a dungeon, or roleplay during a social gathering.

rule.name: Downtime
rule.comment: During downtime, the characters are at little risk, and the passage of time is measured in days or longer. This is when you might forge a magic sword, research a new spell, or prepare for your next adventure.

rule.name: The GM Has the Final Say
rule.comment: If you’re ever uncertain how to apply a rule, the GM decides.

rule.name: Specific Overrides General
rule.comment: A core principle of Pathfinder is that specific rules override general ones. If two rules conflict, the more specific one takes precedence. If there’s still ambiguity, the GM determines which rule to use.

rule.name: Rounding
rule.comment: Always round down unless otherwise specified.

rule.name: Multiplying
rule.comment: When more than one effect would multiply the same number, don’t multiply more than once. Instead, combine all the multipliers into a single multiplier, with each multiple after the first adding 1 less than its value.

rule.name: Duplicate effects
rule.comment: When you’re affected by the same thing multiple times, only one instance applies, using the higher level of the effects, or the newer effect if the two are the same level.
rule.calculations: total modifier = Sum(Max(modifier, Group By type))

rule.name: Order of check results
rule.comment: critical failure, failure, success, critical success

rule.name: Multiple attack penalty
rule.comment: The more attacks you make beyond your first in a single turn, the less accurate you become.
rule.calculations: penalty = Max((i - 1) * (-5), -10), for i-th attack in turn

rule.name: Range penalty
rule.comment: Ranged and thrown weapons each have a listed range increment, and attacks with them grow less accurate against targets farther away.
rule.calculations: range penalty = IntegerDivide(distance to target, equipment's range) * (-2)

rule.name: Maximum weapon range
rule.comment: You can attempt to attack with a ranged weapon or thrown weapon up to six range increments away.

rule.name: Melee attack roll
rule.comment: Roll for strike with melee weapon.

rule.name: Melee attack check
rule.comment: Strike with melee weapon against target's armor class.
